title: calligraphy font
content:
Any guess what type of calligraphy these capital letters are? Just the capital letters and not the lower case ones. Iâ€™m guessing that the vines or loops that flow away from the capital letters were added separately for aesthetics and not part of the font. Any ideas? Thanks!

JesseZ.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202150714im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_6037.jpg)
author: jesse zuli

comments.content:
That's a visual oxymoron if ever I saw one.

Nick Cooke

the caps look like some kind of Caslon. not sure, the image is too small.  
you will find at least similar looking swash capitals here:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/search/caslon+swash/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202150714/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/caslon+swash/fonts/ "http://new.myfonts.com/search/caslon+swash/fonts/")
Try [Mutlu Ornamental](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202150714/http:/www.dafont.com/mutlu-ornamental.font). X, A, c, and t
Plumbago you rock! on the nose!! thanks everyone for your input.
